Facility Rentals

More Than Just a Summer Camp

More Than Just a Summer Camp While our campus proudly hosts Lions Camp Horizon each summer, it’s also an ideal venue for group retreats, family reunions, conferences, trainings, special events, and even commercial kitchen use. Tucked away in Bay Horizon Park, our campus is just minutes from Birch Bay and conveniently located near I-5—only 10 minutes from Canada and 20 minutes from Bellingham. Come explore all we have to offer!

Rental Information

  • Who Do We Rent To?

    Our campus is open to a wide variety of groups and events. Whether you’re planning a quiet day retreat, a weekend training, a family reunion, or a full-scale camp, we’re ready to host you. We accommodate everything from small meetings and parties to large overnight groups of up to 184 guests. Church groups, schools, nonprofits, clubs, caterers, and families have all found a place here.

  • Rental Availability

    We offer flexible rental options for day use, weekend stays, or longer group events. Our rental season typically runs from mid-March through October. Our buildings were constructed in 1951, and may need to be winterized during the colder months. Some exceptions apply. Please reach out for late fall or winter rentals.

  • Want to See our Campus?

    Our campus is located in Bay Horizon Park which is open to the public—feel free to take a walk or drive through anytime. If you’d like a closer look at the facilities, we’d be happy to show you around. Contact us to schedule a tour to walk through the buildings and ask any questions you have.

Please note: Our campus is not available for rentals during our summer camp sessions, which run July through early August. We recommend booking early to reserve your preferred dates!

Welcome to Lions Camp Horizon Campus

7506 Gemini St., Blaine, WA 98230

  • Dormitories

    Once home to U.S. Airmen, our four rustic Airforce Station dormitories now provide simple, no-frills lodging for up to 184 guests. Each two-story, heated dorm includes shared restrooms on both floors, a TV lounge, and 17 rooms with 2–3 twin beds in each room—providing a total of 46 beds per building. Guests bring their own bedding and towels.

  • Webster Conference Center

    Our most popular space for meetings and small gatherings, the Conference Building, offers a large open room with folding tables and chairs—perfect for group sessions or presentations. The lower “library” level is great for breakout groups or down time, with lounge style furniture and small kitchenette for food preparation. (Max occupancy 69)

  • Theatre

    It’s time to put on a show! This unique space features theater-style seating and a wheelchair accessible stage, complete with a projection screen—perfect for performances, presentations, or movie nights. There is additional space for tables and chairs, plus a small kitchen area in the back—handy for set up or snacks. (Max occupancy 99)

  • Commercial Kitchen & Dining Hall

    Our commercial kitchen was fully updated in 2017 and comes stocked with professional-grade equipment—great for preparing meals for your group or operating a food-related business. Whether you’re hosting a weekend retreat or need a health- approved space for your business, we’ve got you covered. Special rates are available for businesses using the kitchen regularly, and we’re happy to work with you to find a schedule that fits. The dining hall seats up to 99 guests and features a cafeteria-style heated serving line.

  • Craft Building

    If your group needs space to get creative, our Craft Building is the perfect spot. With plenty of natural light, large tables, and room to spread out, it’s ideal for art projects, crafts, and hands-on activities of all kinds. There’s also a small restroom in the building for convenience. Whether it’s painting, gluing, or just getting messy—this space is ready for your next creative adventure.

  • Game Room

    Our Game Room is a great bonus space to include with your rental. It features a cozy lounge area for cards or games, pool tables, and air hockey. And yes, the rumors are true—this building is also home to a vintage two-lane bowling alley, original to the Air Force station. While it’s not available for public use at this time, it remains a cool piece of the campus’ history.

  • Firepit

    Our fire pit is the perfect place to gather, sing songs, share stories, and make lasting memories under the stars. It comes complete with benches and firewood—just bring the marshmallows and your favorite campfire tunes!

  • Coming Soon- Outdoor Pavilion

    We’re excited to announce a brand-new outdoor pavilion, coming in 2026! This covered gathering space is a generous gift from Andersen Construction, and we can’t wait to share it with our campers, guests, and the community.

When we get together at Camp Horizon, something magical happens. We laugh louder, grow closer and leave as a stronger community. It's the perfect place to unplug, reconnect and soak up the summer camp feeling.

Help us serve our campers!
